item.title: Fatal Fury Confirms Huge Prize Pool
item.description:
Summary

  • Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves will feature a $2.5 million prize pool at the SNK World Championships 2025.
  • Despite a lukewarm release, the game has received positive feedback for its combat, characters, and soundtrack.

Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves will boast an impressive prize pool of $2.5 million at this year's SNK World Championships, despite the game's lukewarm release. While Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves is taking time to build up its fanbase, the game has been met with largely positive feedback following its launch earlier this month.

The first new entry in the franchise in over 25 years, Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves has impressed audiences, with many applauding its combat, soundtrack, characters, and customization options. Unfortunately, early numbers for the title, which was released on April 24, have not matched this enthusiasm, with the max concurrent player count on Steam not even breaking 5,000. This underwhelming performance comes despite an aggressive marketing campaign, with Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves appearing during the recent WrestleMania event and appearing in ads all over the world. Fans of the game may have a chance to win some serious cash later in the year, however, with a recent announcement shocking the title's community.

A new Twitter post has confirmed that Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves will have a prize pool of $2.5 million at this year's SNK World Championship event, with the champion slated to walk away with $1.5 million. Remarkably, this is even more than what was on offer during the 2024 Capcom Cup, with Street Fighter 6 players fighting for $2 million. While the release of Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves has been somewhat quiet, this huge amount of cash may inspire more players to give the fighting title a try. More information regarding qualifier schedules and prizing will be revealed soon, with the main event slated to take place in late 2025.

Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves Boasts a Prize Pool of $2.5 Million at the SNK World Championship 2025

While many classic Fatal Fury characters appear on the newest game's roster, City of the Wolves is the first title to feature guest combatants not created by SNK, including soccer star Cristiano Ronaldo and DJ Salvatore Ganacci, with the latter drawing some criticism. Many in the game's community didn't even recognize the DJ's name, and fighting game fans quickly expressed their confusion over the bizarre choice. DLC roster additions include the Street Fighter characters Chun-Li and Ken Masters, as well as Mr. Big from the Art of Fighting franchise.

The most recent Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves update, which rolled out earlier this month, addressed a slew of bugs and issues, including freezes and crashes. The fighters Terry Bogard, Marco Rodrigues, and Salvatore Ganacci also saw some gameplay tweaks, with the developers promising that more helpful patches will be released in the following months.

item.title: Dragon's Dogma 2 Drops to Lowest Price Ever
item.description:
Summary

  • Dragon's Dogma 2 is now available on Amazon for $28 for a limited time.
  • Capcom has stopped major support for Dragon's Dogma 2 apart from minor updates.
  • Fans speculate on a possible DLC release for Dragon's Dogma 2 in the future.

Dragon's Dogma 2 has been out for just over a year, and it's already fallen to an incredibly low price on Amazon. The long-awaited sequel to Capcom's more niche 2012 RPG, Dragon's Dogma 2 was released last year and became one of the biggest RPGs of 2024, earning Metacritic scores in the high 80s and a Best RPG nomination at The Game Awards. By this time last year, Dragon's Dogma 2 was already closing in on three million total sales.

While Dragon's Dogma 2 was certainly Capcom's biggest 2024 game release, the popular Japanese publisher has put out a few more high-profile titles since. Kunitsu-Gami: Path of the Goddess , a smaller action-strategy game, came out last summer, and among a number of Xbox 360-era remasters, Capcom's Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster was a standout last Fall. This year, Capcom has released its wildly successful Monster Hunter Wilds , which has already become a top contender for Game of the Year. It also has the Onimusha 2: Samurai's Destiny remaster arriving next month.

For Capcom fans who've been holding out for Dragon's Dogma 2 's price to fall, now might be the time to pounce, as the fantasy RPG sequel is currently available on Amazon for just $27.99, a dramatic drop from its original $70 price tag. The deal is only for the physical version of the game and is available for PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S gamers. It's not noted how long the deal will remain live, but both Xbox and PlayStation copies are marked with a "Limited-Time Deal" tag, so interested gamers should act fast.

Dragon's Dogma 2 is $28 on Amazon for a Limited Time

Since Dragon's Dogma 2 isn't a live service game, it makes sense that Capcom has halted support for the title with the exception of a few minor bug-squashing patches and a PlayStation 5 Pro support update. Seeing that many of Capcom's major titles receive some form of DLC, including the original Dragon's Dogma , fans have been expecting the publisher to come out with a reveal of Dragon's Dogma 2 DLC, though nothing has been confirmed to this point. Snagging Dragon's Dogma 2 now at $28 would ultimately help buyers in the long-run, as potential Dragon's Dogma 2 DLC likely won't be free. Taking advantage of this Amazon deal could mean that fans might be able to score the full game and all of its potential DLCs for less than the game's original asking price of $70.

Looking ahead, Capcom is positioned to have a super-strong next few years, as its Okami sequel and new Onimusha entry named Way of the Sword are both in the pipeline. Additionally, many feel that it's high-time for the next mainline Resident Evil game, and some speculate it could even be revealed at some point this year. Capcom fans should stay glued to the publisher's social media for any news on these future titles, as well as for potential Dragon's Dogma 2 DLC news.

item.title: Morrowind and Skyrim Get Player Count Boosts
item.description:
Summary

  • Oblivion Remastered's success is prompting gamers to revisit older Elder Scrolls titles like Skyrim and Morrowind.
  • Skyrim has seen a 26% increase in players on Xbox, with the original Oblivion jumping by 113% this week on the platform.
  • Oblivion Remastered reached over 4 million players in its first three days.

Recent data shows that the success of Oblivion Remastered is possibly making some gamers return to older Elder Scrolls titles such as Skyrim and Morrowind . New releases in well-known franchises often inspire some gamers to return to more classic entries, and this time around, it seems that even incredibly popular titles like Skyrim have benefited from the recent release.

The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered was shadow dropped on April 21, after its existence had been rumored for months. Published by Bethesda and developed by Virtuos, the remaster essentially overhauled the game with improved graphics made using Unreal Engine 5, but it maintained the most important aspects of the classic open world.

Due to the success of Oblivion Remastered , other Elder Scrolls games are being positively affected. According to reports from TrueAchievements, Skyrim Special Edition has seen an increase of 26% in Xbox players, while the game’s standard version has risen by 28% on the same platform. The original Oblivion was also affected, jumping by 113% this week, and Morrowind has seen a “slight boost in players,” which was not as significant as these other, more recent titles. The data also indicated that The Elder Scrolls Online has seen an increase of 5% in its player count. However, the reports attribute this hike to the announcement of a new expansion for the game.

Skyrim Gets a Player Boost After Oblivion Remastered Is Released

While the data does not explain the exact reason why gamers are returning to the original Oblivion and Skyrim , it’s not hard to speculate. Oblivion Remastered reached over 4 million players in only three days, and this success has likely prompted gamers to go back to previous games to compare their experience or just feel the nostalgia.

This is not the first time that some of Bethesda’s old games have been influenced by major releases. Last year, the player count of Fallout 4 surged by 33% soon after Amazon’s live-action TV show inspired by the franchise was released.

It’s possible that the popularity of the remaster may also benefit an upcoming release: Skyblivion, a project that aims to remake Oblivion using Skyrim . A few weeks ago, the lead developer of Skyblivion stated his support of Oblivion Remastered , confirming that his “passion project” will still be released. While it’s impossible to say how popular Skyblivion will be, gamers will likely be interested in comparing it to the official remaster, which could increase its player count after the mod is released later in 2025.

item.title: What Happens to Stars at the End of Movie Night in Monopoly GO
item.description:
Sticker collecting is a huge part of Monopoly GO . Whenever a new sticker album drops, players work on collecting all the stickers to complete sets and grab its rewards. Right now, the Movie Night album is live, and it has 162 stickers across 20 different sets.

As you open your sticker packs, you will sometimes get some duplicate stickers. Even after trading them, you might still have a bunch left over. The game turns these extra stickers into stars. But what happens to your stars once the Movie Night sticker album ends? Let’s talk about it.

What Happens to Stars When Movie Night Ends in Monopoly GO

When a sticker season ends in Monopoly GO , everything related to it (the stickers, sticker sets, and rewards) gets wiped out. That includes your stars too.

As mentioned above, when you get duplicate stickers for your Movie Night sticker album, the game turns them into stars. You can use those stars to grab some cool rewards by heading over to the Stickers for Rewards section in the game.

Vault

Cost

Rewards

Orange Vault

250 Stars

200 Dice Rolls, Three-Star Sticker Pack

Blue Vault

450 Stars

350 Dice Rolls, Three-Star and Four-Star Sticker Packs

Gold Vault

700 Stars

500 Dice Rolls, Four-Star and Five-Star Sticker Packs, Swap Pack

But you can only use your stars while the Movie Night season is still live. Once it ends, the game will reset your stars and give you dice rolls for them instead. But there’s a limit. You will get 750 dice rolls for 700 stars . If you have more stars than that, they’ll just disappear.

item.title: Monopoly GO: Riches On Set Rewards And Milestones
item.description:
Peg-E’s Sticker Drop is back in Monopoly GO , and that means there’s a new solo event for players to participate in. This time around, Scopely has introduced a three-day event called Riches on Set . This event is going to run from April 28, 2025, to May 1, 2025, giving players ample time to reach milestones and collect rewards.

The Riches on Set event is the first event where you can start collecting Peg-E tokens for the Sticker Drop in Monopoly GO . Check out the full list of milestones and rewards for the Riches on Set event below.

How To Get Points In Monopoly GO Riches On Set Event

To score points in the Riches On Set event, you need to land your token on the Tax, Utility, or Chance tiles as you make your way around your Monopoly GO board. Each time you land on one of these squares, you'll automatically collect points, bringing you closer to those milestone rewards.

As you approach a Tax or Utility tile, consider increasing your dice multiplier. This way, you’ll get even more points and reach those milestones quicker. Remember, you have three days to hit all the 62 milestones and snag the rewards.
